ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version

about.summary: Provides a drop-in replacement for rasterize() from the 'raster' package that takes polygon vector or data frame objects, and is much faster. There is support for the main options provided by the rasterize() function, including setting the field used and background value, and options for aggregating multi-layer rasters. Uses the scan line algorithm attributed to Wylie et al. (1967) <doi:10.1145/1465611.1465619>.

Provides a drop-in replacement for rasterize() from the 'raster' package that takes polygon vector or data frame objects, and is much faster. There is support for the main options provided by the rasterize() function, including setting the field used and background value, and options for aggregating multi-layer rasters. Uses the scan line algorithm attributed to Wylie et al. (1967) <doi:10.1145/1465611.1465619>.

name: r-fasterize

about.summary: Provides a drop-in replacement for rasterize() from the 'raster' package that takes polygon vector or data frame objects, and is much faster. There is support for the main options provided by the rasterize() function, including setting the field used and background value, and options for aggregating multi-layer rasters. Uses the scan line algorithm attributed to Wylie et al. (1967) <doi:10.1145/1465611.1465619>.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.1.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-fasterize
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/fasterize_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/fasterize/fasterize_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 231aa04f505ec08162edfc3f3a410205a2bfde6c3261415ef7258f1ddab2375f

build:
  number: 2
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  ## NB: missing win r-raster (track https://github.com/conda-forge/r-raster-feedstock/issues/34)
  skip: true  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}          # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}            # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}    # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}      # [win]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}        # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_cxx') }}  # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-codetools
    - r-rcpp
    - r-rcpparmadillo
    - r-raster >=2.8_3
    - r-wk
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-rcpp
    - r-rcpparmadillo
    - r-raster >=2.8_3
    - r-wk

test:
  requires:
    - r-codetools
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('fasterize')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('fasterize')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/ecohealthalliance/fasterize
  license: MIT
  summary: Provides a drop-in replacement for rasterize() from the 'raster' package that takes polygon vector or data frame objects, and is much faster. There is support for the main options provided by the rasterize() function, including setting the field used and background value, and options for aggregating multi-layer
    rasters. Uses the scan line algorithm attributed to Wylie et al. (1967) <doi:10.1145/1465611.1465619>.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - xhochy
